definition: to bid (bridge and similar card games)
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: No rectification or redress is due to a player who acts on the basis of his own misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 牌手因本身誤解作出的叫牌，無權提出修正或改正。

sentences.english: That was a clever move with your cards to take out your opponent.
sentences.chinese: 你的牌打得高明，讓對手改叫牌。

sentences.english: The double of 5H invited partner to bid on.
sentences.chinese: 加倍5H是邀請搭檔繼續叫牌。

sentences.english: A call repeated with a much different meaning shall be deemed a different call.
sentences.chinese: 一個具有不同含義的重複叫牌，也被認爲是不同叫牌。

sentences.english: A call repeated with a much different meaning shall be deemed a different call.
sentences.chinese: 一個具有不同含義的重複叫牌，也被認爲是不同叫牌。

sentences.english: A player may require clarification forthwith if he is in doubt what call has been made.
sentences.chinese: 要是牌手對已經做出的叫牌有疑惑，可以要求澄清。

sentences.english: The higher the level of the game, the more important bidding has become.
sentences.chinese: 大賽的水平越高，就越能顯現叫牌的重要。

sentences.english: The second (intended) call stands and is subject to the appropriate Law.
sentences.chinese: 更改叫牌成立並且受相干條律保護。

sentences.english: Also, you cannot bid zero tricks and are not penalized for overbidding .
sentences.chinese: 另外，你還不可以投零賭注並且叫牌過高也不受處罰。

sentences.english: Why do you shut out calls at the opening bidding?
sentences.chinese: 開叫時你爲什麼用關煞叫阻止對方叫牌？

definition: to draw a tile (at mahjong)/to play mahjong
gambling get-together/game of cards, mahjong etc
to pour/to pour down (of rain)/to lay a bet
